reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 206/06: USE OF COMMUTER PARKING LOTS, TRANSIT STATIONS AND REST, SERVICE AND OTHER AREAS
reg_info.reg_name_text: USE OF COMMUTER PARKING LOTS, TRANSIT STATIONS AND REST, SERVICE AND OTHER AREAS
reg_info.act_under: Public Transportation and Highway Improvement Act   Loi sur l’aménagement des voies publiques et des transports en commun

content.section: Parking in a commuter parking lot or transit station
content.content: 1. (1) No person shall park a vehicle on any part of a commuter parking lot or transit station that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister where parking is prohibited by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 1 (1). (2) Where parking is permitted on a commuter parking lot that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister, no person shall leave a vehicle parked for longer than 120 consecutive hours. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 1 (2). (3) Despite subsection (2), even where parking is permitted on a commuter parking lot described in that subsection, no person shall leave a vehicle that is wider than 2.1 metres parked and unattended for any period of time. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 1 (3).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) No person shall park a vehicle on any part of a commuter parking lot or transit station that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister where parking is prohibited by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 1 (1).

(2) Where parking is permitted on a commuter parking lot that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister, no person shall leave a vehicle parked for longer than 120 consecutive hours. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 1 (2).

(3) Despite subsection (2), even where parking is permitted on a commuter parking lot described in that subsection, no person shall leave a vehicle that is wider than 2.1 metres parked and unattended for any period of time. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 1 (3).

content.section: Parking in a rest, service or other area
content.content: 2. (1) No person shall park a vehicle on any part of a rest, service or other area that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister where parking is prohibited by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 2 (1). (2) No person shall park a vehicle between the hours of 11 p.m. and 5 a.m. on any part of a rest, service or other area that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister unless parking is permitted by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 2 (2).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) No person shall park a vehicle on any part of a rest, service or other area that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister where parking is prohibited by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 2 (1).

(2) No person shall park a vehicle between the hours of 11 p.m. and 5 a.m. on any part of a rest, service or other area that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister unless parking is permitted by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 2 (2).

content.section: Camping in a rest, service or other area
content.content: 3. No person shall camp on any part of a rest, service or other area that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister unless camping is permitted by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. No person shall camp on any part of a rest, service or other area that is constructed, maintained or operated by the Minister unless camping is permitted by appropriate signs. O. Reg. 206/06, s. 3.

content.section: Camping in a rest, service or other area
content.content: 4. Omitted (revokes other Regulations). O. Reg. 206/06, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. Omitted (revokes other Regulations). O. Reg. 206/06, s. 4.

content.section: Camping in a rest, service or other area
content.content: 5. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 206/06, s. 5.
content.raw_html: 5. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 206/06, s. 5.
